report_title: Local Freight Trucking in the US
executive_summary: Local freight truckers have enjoyed predominantly favorable conditions for both revenue and profitability since 2019, even as input costs swung. Diesel prices surged amid the pandemic's recovery, enabling sharp revenue growth as truckers imposed fuel surcharges. Rising consumer spending and confidence boosted manufacturing activity, which increased demand for truckers to carry input materials and finished products. Still, high interest rates have recently limited freight volumes for truckers carrying industrial products.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: High Interest Rates are Weighing on Purchases of Local Freight Truckers' Freight
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Federal Reserve introduced a series of interest rate hikes in an effort to curb surging inflation. Interest rates reached a 22-year high in 2023, making financing new investments very difficult for businesses across the economy. Many local freight truckers carry freight intended for use in construction or mining industries. As these end users slow operations and avoid expanding, manufacturing companies cut production and operate at lower capacity. Logistics companies saw dampened demand and smaller freight volumes in 2023.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Revenue Skyrocketed as Production Recovered From the Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consumer spending jumped in 2021 as government stimulus and returning job security encouraged consumers to make purchases the pandemic had previously encouraged them to hold off on. Manufacturing industries raised production capacities to service heightened demand. More manufacturing activity means more trucks are needed to bring input materials to factories and carry finished products to wholesalers and retailers, boosting revenue for local freight trucking companies.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Fuel Surcharges Brought Booming Revenue Until 2023
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: When fuel prices rise, local freight truckers across the board implement fuel surcharges to pass heightened costs downstream and protect their margins. Fuel surcharges bring revenue growth, though truckers usually can't pass costs fully downstream. As pent-up demand for industrial production and travel was released in 2021, the price of fuel skyrocketed. Local freight truckers successfully passed these heightened input costs on to clients in 2021 and 2022, perpetuating already-surging industry revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Tightening Regulations Will Drag Down Profit
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The EPA finalized a new rule in March 2024 to limit greenhouse gas emissions from heavy-duty vocational vehicles, including the industry's trucks. These tightened regulations will apply to every truck model year 2027 through 2032. Local freight truckers have some options for cutting their emissions.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rising Consumer Spending Will Boost Manufacturing Activity
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Growing disposable income means consumers will be more comfortable spending money on discretionary goods. Purchased goods will need to be delivered from manufacturers to wholesalers, retailers and consumers, creating more opportunities for local freight truckers to offer their services. Consumers have increasingly looked to retail options that cater to their demand for convenience, most notably e-commerce platforms.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Continued Vertical Integration Downstream Will Temper Revenue Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Companies like Walmart and Pepsi already operate their own trucking departments, eliminating the need to hire local freight truckers to move cargo through the supply chain.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rail Transport Will Become More Prominent
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: External competition will challenge local truckers' share of freight transportation, especially in the medium range.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Input Costs Are Set To Remain High For Diesel Truckers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Oil and diesel prices are expected to fall after the volatile past five years as worldwide production ramps up to accommodate the lack of supply from Ukraine.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry provide general freight trucking services over short distances. General freight companies handle a variety of commodities, which are usually palletized and transported in a container or van trailer. Local general freight trucking companies commonly provide trucking within a metropolitan area that may cross state lines, and the trips are typically same-day return.

FAQs.question: How did lower discretionary spending affected your major consumers?
FAQs.answer: A decline in discretionary spending reduces the volume of finished consumer goods and manufacturing inputs in need of industry transportation services.

FAQs.question: EPA EMISSIONS REGULATIONS
FAQs.answer: The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) imposed new greenhouse gas emissions regulations in 2016.

FAQs.question: TRADE ORGANIZATIONS
FAQs.answer: The American Trucking Association (ATA) represents local freight truckers' political and economic interests.

FAQs.question: How does your company handle changes in industrial, trade and retail activity?
FAQs.answer: During periods of weak industrial production and international trade activity, most local freight trucking companies charge lower rates.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile crude oil prices in recent years?
FAQs.answer: As fuel represents a major input for freight truckers.
